shapes3d
Class Tube

java.lang.Object
  shapes3d.Shape3D
      shapes3d.Mesh2DCore
          shapes3d.Mesh2DCoreWithCaps
              shapes3d.Tube
All Implemented Interfaces:
processing.core.PConstants
public class Tube
extends Mesh2DCoreWithCaps

This class represents a tube its length along the y [0,1,0] axis.
The tube can be 'deformed' by setting the radii (x & z axis) at each end as well as the height.
The centre of rotation is the centre of the tube halfway along its length.
By default the tube will have end caps. Each end cap can have its own

  • draw mode
  • fill color
  • stroke color
  • stroke weight
  • texture
  • visibility
The methods to set the end cap properties can be found in the Mesh2DCoreWithCaps class documentation. The following constants should be used when specifying which cap(s) are to be affected. Tube.S_CAP Tube.E_CAP Tube.BOTH_CAP

Author:
Peter Lager

Tube

public Tube(processing.core.PApplet app,
            int nbrSlices,
            int nbrSegments,
            processing.core.PVector orrientation,
            processing.core.PVector centreOfRotation)
Create a tube.
The shape is recalculated so the [0,1,0] axis is now 'up'
The shape's coordinates are translated to make 'centreOfRot' the objects centre of rotation.

Parameters:
app - the PApplet to draw this shape
nbrSlices - number of slices along length
nbrSegments - number of sections around tube
orrientation -
centreOfRotation -
